title: Encoding and decoding of information for wireless transmission using multi-antenna transceivers
abstract: Methods, systems, and apparatus, including computer programs encoded on computer storage media, for training and deploying machine-learned communication over multi-input-multi-output (MIMO) channels. One of the methods includes: determining a transmitter and a receiver, at least one of which implements a machine-learning network; determining a MIMO channel model; determining first information; using the transmitter to process the first information and generate first RF signals representing inputs to the MIMO channel model; determining second RF signals representing outputs of the MIMO channel model, each second RF signal representing aggregated reception of the first RF signals altered by transmission through the MIMO channel model; using the receiver to process the second RF signals and generate second information as a reconstruction of the first information; calculating a measure of distance between the second and first information; and updating the machine-learning network based on the measure of distance between the second and first information.
claims:
1. A method performed by at least one processor to communicate using multiple transmit antennas and multiple receive antennas over a multi-input-multi-output (MIMO) communication channel, the method comprising:
receiving, using a plurality of receive antennas of the multiple receive antennas, a plurality of first radio frequency (RF) signals over the MIMO communication channel, the plurality of first RF signals corresponding to first information transmitted from a source device over the MIMO communication channel;
processing the plurality of first RF signals using at least one first machine-learning network to generate second information as a reconstruction of the first information having been altered by transmission through the MIMO communication channel;
estimating, using the second information, channel state information (CSI) corresponding to the MIMO communication channel, the CSI indicating at least one of
a state of the MIMO communication channel,
spatial information corresponding to the multiple receive antennas, or
scheduling information corresponding to multiple users of the MIMO communication channel; and
processing, using the estimated CSI, a plurality of second RF signals for transmission over the MIMO communication channel using a plurality of transmit antennas of the multiple transmit antennas.
2. The method of claim 1, wherein estimating the CSI using the second information comprises:
processing the second information using at least one second machine-learning network; and
estimating the CSI based on processing the second information using the at least one second machine-learning network.
3. The method of claim 1, wherein processing the plurality of second RF signals for transmission using the plurality of transmit antennas of the multiple transmit antennas comprises:
determining beams corresponding to the plurality of second RF signals, including adjusting one or more parameters associated with the beams using the estimated CSI; and
generating the beams using the plurality of transmit antennas.
4. The method of claim 1, wherein receiving the plurality of first RF signals using the plurality of receive antennas of the multiple receive antennas comprises receiving the plurality of first RF signals using a receiver corresponding to the multiple receive antennas, and
wherein processing the plurality of second RF signals for transmission using the plurality of transmit antennas of the multiple transmit antennas comprises processing the plurality of second RF signals for transmission using a transmitter corresponding to the multiple receive antennas.
5. The method of claim 4, wherein the receiver and the transmitter are associated with a base station and the source device corresponds to a mobile device,
wherein receiving the plurality of first RF signals comprises receiving, using the receiver associated with the base station, the plurality of first RF signals from the mobile device communicating with the base station, and
wherein processing the plurality of second RF signals for transmission comprises processing, using the transmitter associated with the base station, the plurality of second RF signals for transmission to the mobile device.
6. The method of claim 4, wherein the receiver and the transmitter are associated with a mobile device and the source device corresponds to a base station,
wherein receiving the plurality of first RF signals comprises receiving, using the receiver associated with the mobile device, the plurality of first RF signals from the base station communicating with the mobile device, and
wherein processing the plurality of second RF signals for transmission comprises processing, using the transmitter associated with the mobile device, the plurality of second RF signals for transmission to the base station.
7. The method of claim 6, wherein the base station includes at least one third machine-learning network employed to generate the plurality of first RF signals corresponding to first information transmitted over the MIMO communication channel, the method further comprising:
obtaining, by the base station, the estimated CSI from the mobile device;
updating, by the base station using the estimated CSI, one or more network weights of the at least one third machine-learning network; and
processing, using the at least one third machine-learning network updated using the estimated CSI, a plurality of third RF signals corresponding to third information for transmission to the mobile device over the MIMO communication channel.
